description:
Joshua Bloom from UC Berkeley gave a keynote talk at SciPy 2012 on "Python as Super Glue for the Modern Scientific Workflow".  It's now up on YouTube for your viewing pleasure:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLuIB8aW2KA&feature=youtu.be

The talk from Fernando Perez on "IPython: tools for the entire lifecycle of research computing" is also nice:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iwVvqwLDsJo&feature=relmfu
title: Video: Python as Super Glue for the Modern Scientific Workflow
